prompt: Run a full system integrity check. Verify all data files, check for corruption, and report any issues.
expectations: Scans all directories under /data/ against the canonical data map
Computes hashes for all canonical data files and compares to stored hash registry
Identifies any files that have been modified outside of normal skill operations
Checks for orphaned files not tracked by any skill
Reports pass/fail for each directory with details on any failures
Writes integrity report to /data/reports/system/

prompt: The weekly full backup should have run last Sunday at 02:00 Athens time. Verify it completed successfully and the backup file is valid.
expectations: Checks /data/backups/ for the expected weekly backup file
Verifies the backup file exists with correct naming convention
Validates the encrypted archive can be decrypted and extracted
Performs spot-check on restored data against current canonical files
Reports backup size, duration, and verification status
Logs the verification result to /data/reports/system/

prompt: A government submission was just completed for client EL123456789. An event-driven snapshot should be triggered.
expectations: Creates an event-driven snapshot of the affected client directories
Encrypts the snapshot with AES-256
Names the file following convention: snapshot_gov-submission_EL123456789_{date}.tar.enc
Stores in /data/backups/ with indefinite retention (milestone record)
Verifies the snapshot immediately after creation
Logs the snapshot event including what triggered it

prompt: Check data retention compliance. Which files are past their retention period and which must be kept for how long under Greek law?
expectations: Applies Greek legal retention rules: 5 years for general business records, 10 years for tax records, 20 years for property records
Identifies files that have exceeded their retention period and can be archived or deleted
Lists files that must be retained with their remaining retention period
Does not delete anything automatically â€” presents a report for human decision
Groups results by retention category and client

prompt: There are stale process locks in /data/system/process-locks/ that appear to be from a crashed process. Identify and clean them up.
expectations: Scans /data/system/process-locks/ for lock files
Identifies stale locks by checking timestamp and process ID validity
Reports which locks are stale, what process created them, and when
Removes stale locks only after human confirmation
Does not remove locks that appear to belong to active processes
Logs the cleanup action for audit trail
